characterDescriptions.Noah Lyles: muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear, confident powerful stance, focused intense expression

scenes.prompt: A muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear standing on the running track in a confident pose. A nameplate shows 'NOAH LYLES'. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.
A muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear with the letters 'ADHD' floating beside him. His expression shows focus despite the condition. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.

scenes.text: Noah Lyles is the world's fastest man right now.
scenes.prompt: A muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear crossing a finish line with arms raised in victory. A gold medal icon and world record indicator float beside him. Speed lines trail behind. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.
The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear shaking his head 'no' at a fuel tank labeled 'WILLPOWER'. He rejects it completely. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.
The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear shaking his head 'no' at a whip labeled 'DISCIPLINE'. He rejects this too. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.
The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear wearing engineer goggles, working on a blueprint. He builds rather than chases. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.
Close-up of the muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear with 'ADHD' letters beside his head. His expression is matter-of-fact. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.

scenes.text: He knows his brain can't be trusted to show up consistently.
scenes.prompt: A cartoon brain with small arms and legs, expressive face on the frontal lobe, shown as unreliable with flickering on/off signals. The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear looks at it with understanding, not frustration. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.

scenes.text: So he doesn't rely on it.
scenes.prompt: The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear turning away from a cartoon brain with small arms and legs, expressive face on the frontal lobe. He walks toward something else. The brain is not the solution. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.

scenes.text: He relies on his internal rhythm instead.
scenes.prompt: The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear with a metronome visualization around him. The rhythm is steady and consistent. He moves in sync with it. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.

scenes.text: When the gun goes off, he says something interesting: "I'm not thinking. My body already knows what to do."
scenes.prompt: The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear in starting blocks as a starting gun fires. A speech bubble shows 'My body already knows'. His expression is calm and automatic. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.

The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear and a cartoon brain with small arms and legs, expressive face on the frontal lobe, standing peacefully side by side. No conflict. A crossed-out boxing ring in the background. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.

The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear operating a cartoon brain with small arms and legs, expressive face on the frontal lobe, like a tool. The brain works for him. They collaborate. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.

scenes.text: Those routines give him that edge.
scenes.prompt: The muscular runner with dreadlocks in athletic wear crossing the finish line just barely ahead of another runner. His routines visualized as gears powering him forward. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.

scenes.text: Why wouldn't you use the same logic?
scenes.prompt: Standing cartoon person with a thoughtful expression, one hand on chin. The muscular runner's routine system floats beside them as an option. Simple cartoon style with clean lines.
